name: biomni-query-gtopdb
title: Biomni: Query Gtopdb
description: Query the Guide to PHARMACOLOGY (GtoPdb) for curated data on drug targets, ligands, and pharmacological interactions.
content:
Overview

Searches GtoPdb, an expert-curated resource of drug targets and their interactions with ligands. Provides quantitative pharmacological data on receptors, ion channels, enzymes, transporters, and their small molecule ligands with binding affinities, selectivity, and functional effects.

Input Parameters

  • prompt (string, optional): Natural language query about drug targets or ligands
  • endpoint (string, optional): Specific GtoPdb API endpoint
  • verbose (boolean, optional): Enable detailed logging output (default: true)

Input Format

Create a JSON file with the following structure:

{
  "prompt": "Find serotonin receptor ligands",
  "endpoint": "/targets",
  "verbose": true
}

Biological Use Case

Essential for drug discovery, pharmacology research, and understanding drug mechanisms of action. Researchers use GtoPdb to identify validated drug targets, discover selective ligands, compare binding affinities, understand off-target effects, and design new therapeutic compounds. Critical for medicinal chemistry and pharmaceutical development.

Output

Returns a JSON file (gtopdb_results.json) containing target information including receptor subtypes, ligand binding data (Ki, IC50, EC50 values), selectivity profiles, approved drug information, clinical development status, and links to pharmacological literature and chemical structures.

Category

database
